intro: Tephrosia sengaensis, commonly known as African senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are arranged in racemes, and it produces slender, hairy pods containing several seeds. Tephrosia sengaensis is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
